title.rendered: “Preparing for War in the North: IDF Chief of Staff’s Strategic Assessment and Commitment to Security”

content.rendered:
IDF Spokesperson:

The Chief of Staff at the Northern border: We do not compromise on our achievements – we are preparing for war in the North

The Chief of Staff held a situation assessment today (Wednesday) and spoke with reserve commanders at the border with Lebanon, along with the Commander of the Northern Command, Major General Uri Gordin and the Commander of Division 91, Brigadier General Shai Klapper.

Subsequently, he toured the city of Metulla and met with the heads of the authorities in the North.

A video with the Chief of Staff’s comments is attached: https://bit.ly/4bzmGQB

A video from the visit is attached: https://bit.ly/3HYETJJ

Pictures on the subject are attached: https://idfanc.activetrail.biz/ANC857659

The Chief of Staff’s full remarks are attached: “I want you to know something – we’re not finishing this without returning the residents to Metulla and all the settlements in the North, with very high security. Now you ask me how this will happen? We’re in uniform, and even when you go home, the role is to think readiness for war. This is our primary mission, no one shares this with us and we’re now focused on being ready for war in the North.
This dialogue between us and local leadership here is very, very important, so I’m telling you, in the end we will be ready for war, if it doesn’t end with war, it won’t end with compromising on achievements, Hezbollah is not here on the border, we will push back all capabilities, it will be much quieter here, there will be much more stability and then we’ll say residents can return. Is it happening tomorrow? Probably not, it will take some time. I think residents from my conversation with leadership would prefer more time but bring us to a good outcome.”
